ai-ud5.2:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud5.2:1.3_0: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Ānanda came out of retreat and went to the Buddha.
ai-ud5.2:1.5_0: He said, “It’s incredible, sir, it’s amazing!
ai-ud5.2:1.6_0: How short-lived was the Blessed One’s mother! For seven days after the Blessed One was born, his mother passed away and was reborn in the host of Joyful Gods.”
ai-ud5.2:2.1_0: “That’s so true, Ānanda! For the mothers of beings intent of awakening are short-lived.
ai-ud5.2:2.2_0: Seven days after the beings intent on awakening are born, their mothers pass away and are reborn in the host of Joyful Gods.”
ai-ud5.2:3.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud5.2:4.2_0: all depart, leaving the body behind.
ai-ud5.2:4.3_0: The skillful, understanding that all is lost,
ai-ud5.2:4.4_0: would keenly practice the spiritual life.”
